intro: Sida capillaris, commonly known as slender sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is characterized by its slender stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Sida capillaris is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks.
